verses.name: Proverbs 1:1
verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:2
verses.text: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:3
verses.text: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:4
verses.text: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:5
verses.text: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:6
verses.text: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:7
verses.text: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:8
verses.text: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:9
verses.text: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:10
verses.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:11
verses.text: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:12
verses.text: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:13
verses.text: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:14
verses.text: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:15
verses.text: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:16
verses.text: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:17
verses.text: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:18
verses.text: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:19
verses.text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:20
verses.text: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:21
verses.text: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,

verses.name: Proverbs 1:22
verses.text: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?

verses.name: Proverbs 1:23
verses.text: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:24
verses.text: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:25
verses.text: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:26
verses.text: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;

verses.name: Proverbs 1:27
verses.text: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:28
verses.text: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:29
verses.text: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the Lord:

verses.name: Proverbs 1:30
verses.text: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:31
verses.text: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:32
verses.text: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.

verses.name: Proverbs 1:33
verses.text: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
